header: This is a 20.4-second music video edit across 17 segments. The goal was a high-energy cut, but the library is currently bottlenecked by a lack of payoff shots.

advisor.hero: The library is starving for real payoff shots, which forced me to prioritize the beat over the story just to keep the edit from falling apart.
advisor.body: We hit a technical score of 8.0, but the 'severe' and 'lack' motifs are completely missing. I had to use structural anchors to maintain the rhythm because the footage didn't have the intensity required for a music video.

friction_log: Started with medium confidence because the heroic opening lacked the intensity I actually wanted.
Confidence stabilized in the middle as I used filler segments to bridge the gaps in the library.
Ended with high confidence in the rhythm, even though the lack of action motifs for the finale was a constant drag.

post_mortem.worked: The sync is tight and the teal-orange grade gives the footage a professional, cohesive look.
post_mortem.didnt: The edit feels hollow in the big moments because we are missing the payoff shots that make a music video land.

next_steps: Capture high-intensity action shots to replace the current structural placeholders.
Source specific payoff footage to resolve the bottleneck in the library.
Build out the 'severe' and 'lack' motif categories to give the edit more emotional range.
technical: Applied a teal-orange golden hour LUT to maintain visual consistency across all clips.
Used a syncopated pacing strategy to mask the lack of semantic variety in the library.
Maintained nominal sync fidelity to ensure the edit stayed locked to the track.
